Data Description: Total number of all staffed inpatient and outpatient beds in your hospital, including all overflow, observation, and active surge/expansion beds used for inpatients and for outpatients (includes all ICU, ED, and observation).
Validation Rules: 2a. All hospital beds must be greater than or equal to 4a. All hospital inpatient bed occupancy. 2a. All hospital beds must be greater than or equal to 3a. All hospital inpatient beds. 2a. All hospital beds must be greater than or equal to 6a. ICU bed occupancy. 2a. All hospital beds must be greater than or equal to 5a. ICU beds.

Data Description: Total number of all staffed inpatient and outpatient adult beds in your hospital, including all overflow and active surge/expansion beds for inpatients and for outpatients (includes all ICU, ED, and observation).
Validation Rules: 2b. All adult hospital beds must be greater than or equal to 3b. Adult hospital inpatient beds. 2b. All adult hospital beds must be less than or equal to 2a. All hospital beds.

Data Description: Total number of staffed inpatient beds in your hospital including all overflow, observation, and active surge/expansion beds used for inpatients (includes all ICU beds). This is a subset of #2.
Validation Rules: 3a. All hospital inpatient beds must be less than or equal to 2a. All hospital beds. 3a. All hospital inpatient beds must be greater than or equal to 4a. All hospital inpatient bed occupancy. 3a. All hospital inpatient beds must be greater than or equal to 6a. ICU bed occupancy. 3a. All hospital inpatient beds must be greater than or equal to 5a. ICU beds.

Data Description: Total number of staffed inpatient adult beds in your hospital including all overflow and active surge/expansion beds used for inpatients (includes all designated ICU beds). This is also a subset of #2.
Validation Rules: 3b. Adult hospital inpatient beds must be less than or equal to 3a. All hospital inpatient beds. 3b. Adult hospital inpatient beds must be less than or equal to 2b. All adult hospital beds.

Data Description: Total number of staffed inpatient beds that are occupied.
Validation Rules: 4a. All hospital inpatient bed occupancy must be less than or equal to 3a. All hospital inpatient beds. 4a. All hospital inpatient bed occupancy must be less than or equal to 2a. All hospital beds. 4a. All hospital inpatient bed occupancy must be greater than or equal to 6a. ICU bed occupancy.

Data Description: Total number of staffed inpatient adult beds that are occupied.
Validation Rules: 4b. Adult hospital inpatient bed occupancy must be less than or equal to 4a. All hospital inpatient bed occupancy.

Data Description: Total number of staffed inpatient ICU beds. This is a subset of #2 and #3.
Validation Rules: 5a. ICU beds must be less than or equal to 2a. All hospital beds. 5a. ICU beds must be less than or equal to 3a. All hospital inpatient beds. 5a. ICU beds must be greater than or equal to 6a. ICU bed occupancy.

Data Description: Total number of staffed inpatient adult ICU beds. This is also a subset of #2 and 3.
Validation Rules: 5b. Adult ICU beds must be less than or equal to 5a. ICU beds.

Data Description: Total number of staffed inpatient ICU beds that are occupied. This is a subset of #4.
Validation Rules: 6a. ICU bed occupancy must be less than or equal to 2a. All hospital beds. 6a. ICU bed occupancy must be less than or equal to 4a. All hospital inpatient bed occupancy. 6a. ICU bed occupancy must be less than or equal to 3a. All hospital inpatient beds. 6a. ICU bed occupancy must be less than or equal to 5a. ICU beds.

Data Description: Total number of staffed inpatient adult ICU beds that are occupied. This is also a subset of #4.
Validation Rules: 6b. Adult ICU bed occupancy must be less than or equal to 6a. ICU bed occupancy.

Data Description: Enter the total number (in use and not in use) of all mechanical ventilators, including adult, pediatric, neonatal ventilators, anesthesia machines and portable/transport ventilators available in the facility. Include BiPAP machines if the hospital uses BiPAP to deliver positive pressure ventilation via artificial airways.
Validation Rules: 7. Total mechanical ventilators must be greater than or equal to 8. Mechanical ventilators in use.

Data Description: Enter the total number of mechanical ventilators in use at the time the data is collected, including adult, pediatric, neonatal ventilators, anesthesia machines and portable/transport ventilators. Include BiPAP machines if the hospital uses BiPAP to deliver positive pressure ventilation via artificial airways.
Validation Rules: 8. Mechanical ventilators in use must be less than or equal to 7. Total mechanical ventilators.

Data Point: 9a. Total hospitalized adult suspected or confirmed positive COVID patients
Data Description: Patients currently hospitalized in an adult inpatient bed who have laboratory-confirmed or suspected COVID-19. Include those in observation beds.

Patients currently hospitalized in an adult inpatient bed who have laboratory-confirmed COVID-19. Include those in observation beds. Include patients who have both laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 and laboratory-confirmed influenza in this field.
Validation Rules: 9b. Hospitalized adult confirmed-positive COVID patients must be less than or equal to 9a. Total hospitalized adult suspected or confirmed positive COVID patients.

Data Point: 10a. Total hospitalized pediatric suspected or confirmed positive COVID patients
Data Description: Patients currently hospitalized in a pediatric inpatient bed, including, NICU, PICU, newborn, and nursery, who are suspected or laboratory- confrimed-positive for COVID-19. Include those in observation beds.

Data Point: 10b. Hospitalized pediatric confirmed- positive COVID patients
Data Description: Patients currently hospitalized in a pediatric inpatient bed, including, NICU, PICU, newborn, and nursery, who have laboratory-confirmed COVID-19. Include those in observation beds. Include patients who have both laboratory- confirmed COVID-19 and laboratory-confirmed influenza in this field.
Validation Rules: 10b. Hospitalized pediatric confirmed-positive COVID patients must be less than or equal to 10a. Total hospitalized pediatric suspected or confirmed positive COVID patients.

Data Description: Patients currently hospitalized in an adult, pediatric or neonatal inpatient bed who have suspected or laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 and are on a mechanical ventilator (as defined in 7 above).

Data Point: 12a. Total ICU adult suspected or confirmed positive COVID patients
Data Description: Patients currently hospitalized in a designated adult ICU bed who have suspected or laboratory-confirmed COVID-19.

Data Point: 12b. Hospitalized ICU adult confirmed-positive COVID patients
Data Description: Patients currently hospitalized in a designated adult ICU bed who have laboratory-confirmed COVID-19. Include patients who have both laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 and laboratory-confirmed influenza in this field.
Validation Rules: 12b. Hospitalized ICU adult confirmed-positive COVID patients must be less than or equal to 12a. Total ICU adult suspected or confirmed positive COVID patients.

Data Description: Total current inpatients with onset of suspected or laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 fourteen or more days after admission for a condition other than COVID-19.
Patients with suspected or laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 who are currently in the Emergency Department (ED) or any overflow location awaiting inpatient bed.
Patients with suspected or laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 who currently are in the ED or any overflow location awaiting an inpatient bed and on a mechanical ventilator. This is a subset of #14.
Validation Rules: 15. ED/overflow and ventilated must be less than or equal to 14. ED/overflow.

Data Description: Enter the total number of patient visits to the ED who were seen on the previous calendar day regardless of reason for visit. Include all patients who are triaged even if they leave before being seen by a provider.

Data Point: 20. Previous day's total COVID-19-related ED visits
Data Description: Enter the total number of ED visits who were seen on the previous calendar day who had a visit related to COVID-19 (meets suspected or confirmed definition or presents for COVID diagnostic testing â€“ do not count patients who present for pre-procedure screening).
Validation Rules: 20. Previous day's COVID-19-related ED visits must be less than or equal to 19. Previous day's total ED visits.

Data Description: Number of patients with suspected or laboratory confirmed COVID-19 who died on the previous calendar day in the hospital, ED, or any overflow location.
Validation Rules: 16. Previous day's COVID-19 deaths must be greater than or equal to 38. Previous day's deaths with both laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 and influenza.

Data Description: Enter the number of patients who were admitted to an adult inpatient bed on the previous calendar day who had confirmed COVID-19 at the time of admission. This is a subset of #9. As a subset, provide the breakdown by age bracket.
Validation Rules: 17a. Total adult must be greater than or equal to sum of all age brackets.

Data Point: 18a. Previous day's pediatric admissions with confirmed COVID-19
Data Description: Enter the number of pediatric patients who were admitted to an inpatient bed, including NICU, PICU, newborn, and nursery, on the previous calendar day who had confirmed COVID-19 at the time of admission. This is a subset of #10.

Data Point: 18b. Previous day's pediatric admissions with suspected COVID-19
Data Description: Enter the number of pediatrics patients who were admitted to an inpatient bed, including NICU, PICU, newborn, and nursery, on the previous calendar day who had suspected COVID-19 at the time of admission. This is a subset of #10.
Enter the number of remdesivir vials used on the previous calendar day in an inpatient, ED, and/or overflow location
Validation Rules: Max value: 999999

Data Description: Enter the number of remdesivir vials in inventory at 11:59pm on the previous calendar day in the hospital pharmacy
Validation Rules: Max value: 999999

Data Description: Enter the number of therapeutic A courses currently in inventory. This field has been designated as Casirivimab / Indevimab and will be mandatory on 1/8/2021.
Validation Rules: Max value: 999999

Data Point: 39b. Courses used in the last week
Data Description: Enter the number of therapeutic A courses used in the previous calendar week in an inpatient, ED, overflow, or outpatient location, such as an urgent care, infusion center, or outpatient clinic. This field has been designated as Casirivimab / Indevimab and will be mandatory on 1/8/2021.
Validation Rules: Max value: 999999

Data Description: Enter the number of therapeutic B courses currently in inventory. This field has been designated as Bamlanivimab and will be mandatory on 1/8/2021.
Validation Rules: Max value: 999999

Data Point: 39d. Courses used in the last week
Data Description: Enter the number of therapeutic B courses used in the previous calendar week in an inpatient, ED, overflow, or outpatient location, such as an urgent care, infusion center, or outpatient clinic. This field has been designated as Bamlanivimab and will be mandatory on 1/8/2021.
Validation Rules: Max value: 999999

Data Description: Select "Yes" if you have a critical staffing shortage today. Select "No" if you do not have a staffing shortage today. If you do not report this value, the default is "No". If you have a shortage, report this daily until the shortage is resolved. Each facility should identify staffing shortages based on their facility needs and internal policies for staffing ratios. The use of temporary staff does not count as a staffing shortage if staffing ratios are met according to the facilityâ€™s needs and internal policies for staffing ratios. (Environmental services, nurses, respiratory therapists, pharmacists and pharmacy technicians, physicians, other licensed independent practitioners, temporary physicians, nurses, respiratory therapists, and pharmacists phlebotomists, other critical healthcare personnel).

Data Point: 24. Critical staffing shortage anticipated within a week (Y/N)
Data Description: Select "Yes" if you anticipate a critical staffing shortage within a week. Select "No" if you do not anticipate a staffing shortage within a week. If you do not report this value, the default is "No". If you have a shortage, report this daily until the shortage is resolved. Each facility should identify staffing shortages based on their facility needs and internal policies for staffing ratios. The use of temporary staff does not count as a staffing shortage if staffing ratios are met according to the facilityâ€™s needs and internal policies for staffing ratios.
(Free text entry)

Data Point: 26. Are your PPE supplies managed (purchased, allocated, and/or stored) at the facility level or, if you are a part of the health system, at the health system level?
Data Description:
Check the response below which reflects the management of PPE for your facility (including purchasing, allocation, and/or storage):
 Health system level or multiple-hospital group (e.g., PPE purchased at the health system level, par levels managed centrally, in stock supply available at another system location such as a central warehouse). Select ""System"" for this choice.
 Facility level (e.g., PPE purchased by your individual facility, par levels managed at the facility-level, in stock supply is all on-site). Select ""Facility"" for this choice."

Data Point: 32. Indicate any specific or critical medical supplies or medication shortages you are currently experiencing or anticipate experiencing in the next three days.
Data Description: (Free text entry)

Data Point: 33. Total hospitalized patients with laboratory- confirmed influenza
Data Description: Patients (all ages_ currently hospitalized in an inpatient bed who have laboratory- confirmed influenza. Include those in observation beds.
Enter the number of patients (all ages) who were admitted to an inpatient bed on the previous calendar day who have laboratory- confirmed inflenza at the time of admission. This is a subset of #33.

Data Point: 35. Total ICU patients with laboratory- confirmed influenza
Data Description: Patients (all ages) currently hospitalized in a designated ICU bed with laboratory- confirmed influenza. This is a subset of #33.

Data Point: 36. Total hospitalized patients with both laboratory- confirmed COVID-19 and influenza
Data Description: Patients (all ages) currently hospitalized in an inpatient bed who have laboratory- confirmed COVID-19 and laboratory-confirmed influenza. This is a subset of #9b/10b and #33.
Number of patients with laboratory-confirmed influenza who died on the previous calendar day in the hospital, ED, or any overflow location.
Validation Rules: 37. Previous day's influenza deaths must be greater than or equal to 38. Previous day's deaths with both laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 and influenza.

Data Point: 38. Previous day's deaths with both laboratory- confirmed COVID-19 and influenza
Data Description: Number of patients with laboratory-confirmed influenza AND laboratory confirmed COVID-19 who died on the previous calendar day in the hospital, ED, or any overflow location. This is a subset of #16.
Validation Rules: 38. Previous day's deaths with both laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 and influenza must be less than or equal to 37. Previous day's influenza deaths.

Data Point: 41. Previous Weekâ€™s COVID-19 vaccination doses administered to healthcare personnel (Regardless of Series)
Data Description: For the previous week, enter the number of COVID-19 vaccination doses administered in the previous week. Enter the count of doses administered regardless of whether it is a first or second dose in a series. For the first week of reporting, include all doses given up to that date.

Data Point: 42. Current healthcare personnel who have not yet received any COVID-19 vaccination doses
Data Description: Enter the number of healthcare personnel who have not yet received a single vaccine dose.

Data Point: 43. Current healthcare personnel who have received one in a series of COVID-19 vaccination doses
Data Description: Enter the current total number of healthcare personnel who have received at least one dose of COVID-19 vaccination that is administered in a multi-dose series. This field is meant to represent those who have begun but not completed the vaccination process. Do not include those who received a single-dose vaccine in this field.

Data Point: 44. Current healthcare personnel who have received a completed series of COVID-19 vaccination doses
Data Description: Enter the current total number of healthcare personnel who have received a complete series of a COVID-19 vaccination. Include those who have received all doses in a multi-dose series as well as those who received a single-dose vaccine.

Data Point: 45. Total number of current healthcare personnel
Data Description: Enter the current total number of healthcare personnel for the facility. Healthcare personnel include all paid and unpaid persons serving in healthcare settings who have the potential for direct or indirect exposure to patients or infectious materials.

Data Point: 46. Previous week's number of patients administered the 1st dose in a COVID-19 vaccination series
Data Description: For the previous week, enter the number of patients who received the first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine that is administered in a multi-dose series. For the first week of reporting, include all doses given up to that date.

Data Point: 47. Previous week's number of patients administered the dose that completes the series of a COVID-19 vaccination
Data Description: For the previous week, enter the number of patients who received the final dose in a COVID-19 vaccination series.
